# performAction(_:)

**Instance Method**

Performs the specified text finding action.

## Declaration

```swift
func performAction(_ op: NSTextFinder.Action)
```

## Parameters

- **op**: The text finding action. See [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextFinder/Action] for the possible values.

## Discussion

Objects that respond to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSResponder/performTextFinderAction(_:)] typically call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextFinder/validateAction(_:)] to ensure that the action is valid and then invoke [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextFinder/performAction(_:)] if validation is successful.

When invoking the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextFinder/validateAction(_:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextFinder/performAction(_:)] the item or sender’s tag should be passed as the parameter. By convention, the `sender` parameter for this method will have an [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextFinder/Action] set as its tag. The responder that receives this method should pass the tag as the action for this method:

```objc
- (void)performTextFinderAction:(id)sender {
    [self.textFinder performAction:[sender tag]];
}
```

## Validating and Performing Text Finding

- **validateAction(_:)**: Allows validation of the find action before performing.
- **cancelFindIndicator()**: Cancels the find indicator immediately.
